category: Herbs that Dispel Wind-Dampness and Reduce Pain (Anti-Rheumatics)

action.primary: Invigorates Blood circulation, breaks up Blood Stasis, reduces swelling and generates flesh

indications: External and traumatic injuries with bruising, swelling, inflammation and pain

action.primary: Clears Heat, eliminates toxins, cools the Blood and relieves pain

indications: Toxic sores, burns, carbuncles and swellings (topical)

action.primary: Dispels Wind and Dampness and relaxes the muscles and sinews

useCases: Hematemesis, abnormal uterine bleeding, epistaxis and hematuria due to Heat.
Acute jaundice with hepatitis, fever anorexia and hepatomegaly.

notes: There are two other herbs with the Pinyin names Tou Gu Cao; Caulis Speranskiae Tuberculata and Caulis Leptostachya.
